Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Alessi Rose is more than ready to conquer the world. That moment is closer than you think, because the charming British singer-songwriter is making waves with her free-spirited alternative pop. It’s entirely homemade, crafted from an original recipe by top chef Rose herself: melodic songs with clever, poetic lyrics about everyday happiness and misfortune. Thanks to her razor-sharp pen and the voice of a competition-ready nightingale, they instantly nestle in your mind. Whether you are in the bedroom or on the dance floor.
My take: Alessi Rose crafts melodic, poetic alternative pop that blends clever lyricism with a free-spirited sound. Her music captures both everyday joy and melancholy, delivered with a strikingly clear and emotive voice.
Festival Bio (EN): Alessi Rose is more than ready to conquer the world. That moment is closer than you think, because the charming British singer-songwriter is making waves with her free-spirited alternative pop. It’s entirely homemade, crafted from an original recipe by top chef Rose herself: melodic songs with clever, poetic lyrics about everyday happiness and misfortune. Thanks to her razor-sharp pen and the voice of a competition-ready nightingale, they instantly nestle in your mind. Whether you are in the bedroom or on the dance floor.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Bente embraces life in grand and sweeping gestures. She acts, takes photos in Het Perfecte Plaatje, joins Maan in standing up against street harassment (“No means No”), and appears on StukTV. But above all, the young songwriter bares her soul in unforgettable songs, breaking through with “Liefste, Ken Je Mij” and pressing on with more brutally honest (electro)pop on her second album “drift”. Whether modest or backed by an orchestra, her music and lyrics reinforce each other, full of variety just like life itself. Her success on Beste Zangers 2025 is a fine new achievement, as is Bente’s natural return to Pinkpop 2026.
My take: Bente's music blends heartfelt, introspective songwriting with a dynamic electropop sound. Her ability to transition between modest, intimate performances and grand, orchestral arrangements showcases her versatility. Tracks like 'Liefste, Ken Je Mij' highlight her emotional depth, while her second album 'drift' explores more raw and honest themes, solidifying her as a compelling voice in contemporary pop.
Festival Bio (EN): Bente embraces life in grand and sweeping gestures. She acts, takes photos in Het Perfecte Plaatje, joins Maan in standing up against street harassment (“No means No”), and appears on StukTV. But above all, the young songwriter bares her soul in unforgettable songs, breaking through with “Liefste, Ken Je Mij” and pressing on with more brutally honest (electro)pop on her second album “drift”. Whether modest or backed by an orchestra, her music and lyrics reinforce each other, full of variety just like life itself. Her success on Beste Zangers 2025 is a fine new achievement, as is Bente’s natural return to Pinkpop 2026.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] You have to be made of strong stuff to win the Limburg Pop Prize. Just ask De Herfshane Band, who get to open Pinkpop this year as “The Promise.” These five young guns from Venlo give the beautiful Limburg dialect wings in catchy sing-along pop that’s firmly rooted in the here and now. Dancing is encouraged, because De Herfshane Band is also a powerhouse live act bursting with zest for life. A golden sound of the future, earning them a well-deserved place of honor on Pinkpop Friday in Landgraaf.
My take: De Herfshane Band stands out for their use of the Limburg dialect in catchy, danceable pop songs, blending regional identity with a modern sound. Their live performances are described as energetic and full of life, making them a promising act in the Dutch music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): You have to be made of strong stuff to win the Limburg Pop Prize. Just ask De Herfshane Band, who get to open Pinkpop this year as “The Promise.” These five young guns from Venlo give the beautiful Limburg dialect wings in catchy sing-along pop that’s firmly rooted in the here and now. Dancing is encouraged, because De Herfshane Band is also a powerhouse live act bursting with zest for life. A golden sound of the future, earning them a well-deserved place of honor on Pinkpop Friday in Landgraaf.

Bio: Di-Rect is a Dutch rock band formed in 1999, known for their dynamic sound blending alternative rock with pop influences and their energetic live performances.
My take: Di-Rect is widely praised for their powerful stage presence and ability to evolve their sound over the years, making them a standout act in the European rock scene.
Festival Bio (EN): The long concert tradition of De Kuip came to an end in 2025 with three sold-out shows by DI-RECT, an immense honor. Another legacy that of iconic guitar bands from The Hague lives on boldly. For over a quarter of a century, these musical powerhouses have kept raising the bar, inspired by everything that rocks: U2, The Who, fellow city legends Golden Earring, or even The War On Drugs. That cheeky punk rock band from 1999 continues to steadily build an indestructible repertoire. Speaking of “Soldier On,” DI-RECT truly lives up to the name.

Bio: Dogstar is an alternative rock band from the USA, best known for featuring actor Keanu Reeves as its bassist. The band gained a cult following in the 1990s with their melodic rock sound and released two studio albums before disbanding in 2002, later reuniting in 2023.
My take: Dogstar's music has been described as solid and enjoyable, though not groundbreaking, with their live performances often drawing attention due to Reeves' presence rather than musical innovation.
Festival Bio (EN): Old rock love never fades. Opening for David Bowie and shining on festival stages around the world left them wanting more, even decades later. In 2020, Keanu Reeves and his bandmates returned to their California garage to create something new. After long days of jamming, the result was the album Somewhere Between the Power Lines and Palm Trees, where the trio explores a different beautiful corner of the musical landscape with each track. With the epic ballad Glimmer, the no-nonsense guitar riffs of Breach, and the summery comeback single Everything Turns Around, Dogstar makes up for lost time in glorious fashion.

Bio: Editors are an English rock band known for their dark, atmospheric sound that blends post-punk revival with indie rock. They have released several critically acclaimed albums, including 'The Back Room' and 'An End Has a Start', and are celebrated for their dynamic live performances.
My take: Editors are widely praised for their ability to create brooding, anthemic tracks and deliver powerful live shows that captivate audiences.
Festival Bio (EN): Being a regular at Pinkpop and other major festivals doesn’t happen by doing the same thing over and over. The crusade of these Brits began in 2005 with the powerful post-punk debut The Back Room, grew to stadium proportions with the rocking follow-up An End Has A Start, and now flirts heavily with electronic influences. Guitar hits like Munich blend seamlessly with the 80s synth vibe of Vibe, thanks in part to the charisma and live experience of Tom Smith and company. Making dance rock and rock danceable, Editors does it like no one else.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Fat Dog pulls out all the stops: rave, rock, electropunk, traditional Jewish party music and yes, even a saxophone. These Londoners didn’t break through with overproduced viral earworms, but with their live reputation: from gigs for just a handful of people and a stray dog, the five-piece barreled straight toward Glastonbury, and this year they’re landing in Landgraaf too. And how—because with festival anthems likeRunningandPray For That, Fat Dog truly unleashes their explosive energy live, fusing dancefloor and moshpit into one wildly partying crowd.
My take: Fat Dog's eclectic mix of rave, rock, electropunk, and traditional Jewish party music, combined with their use of a saxophone, creates a unique and high-energy live experience. Their reputation is built on their dynamic performances, which blend dancefloor and moshpit energy, making them a standout act at festivals like Glastonbury.
Festival Bio (EN): Fat Dog pulls out all the stops: rave, rock, electropunk, traditional Jewish party music and yes, even a saxophone. These Londoners didn’t break through with overproduced viral earworms, but with their live reputation: from gigs for just a handful of people and a stray dog, the five-piece barreled straight toward Glastonbury, and this year they’re landing in Landgraaf too. And how—because with festival anthems likeRunningandPray For That, Fat Dog truly unleashes their explosive energy live, fusing dancefloor and moshpit into one wildly partying crowd.

Bio: Foo Fighters is a Grammy-winning rock band formed in 1994 by former Nirvana drummer Dave Grohl. Known for their energetic performances and anthemic rock songs, they have released numerous critically acclaimed albums and are considered one of the most successful rock acts of their generation.
My take: Foo Fighters are celebrated for their consistent ability to deliver powerful rock anthems and their dynamic live shows, which are often regarded as some of the best in the industry.
Festival Bio (EN): After Dave Grohl single-handedly recorded the first Foo Fighters album in 1994 a lot has happened with the passing of drum legend Taylor Hawkins as the deepest low. But Here We Are is the title of album number eleven we have to carry on. The band rises again with a primal scream that echoes their early sound. For Pinkpop where the weather gods often wink approvingly with a rainbow a shipload of setlist options is already packed. Infinitely beautiful Everlong uplifting Best Of You masterpiece The Pretender Foo Fighters is set to rock Landgraaf hard once again.

Bio: Franz Ferdinand is a Scottish indie rock band formed in Glasgow in 2002, known for their danceable post-punk revival sound and hits like 'Take Me Out' and 'Do You Want To'. They have received critical acclaim, including a Mercury Prize for their self-titled debut album.
My take: Franz Ferdinand is celebrated for their infectious energy, sharp songwriting, and dynamic live performances, making them a staple of the indie rock scene.
Festival Bio (EN): In 2003 the Scottish rockers of Franz Ferdinand won over countless music-loving souls with Take Me Out. More than twenty years later that distinctive sound has lost none of its power quite the opposite. On their latest album The Human Fear from 2025 Alex Kapranos and company show they have perfected the art of writing brilliant guitar riffs and catchy choruses. Add a hefty dose of danceability and you know the field in Landgraaf will once again turn into a surging sea of euphoric Pinkpop fans.

Bio: Giant Rooks is a German indie pop and alternative rock band known for their melodic sound and introspective lyrics. They gained international recognition with their debut album 'Rookery' and have toured extensively across Europe.
My take: Giant Rooks are praised for their polished production and energetic live performances, making them a standout act in the indie scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Leave it to the Germans to put a big smile on your face. With their radiant indie pop these five cheerful birds pluck the sun straight from the sky in any season. Carried by their unstoppable energy and enthusiasm Giant Rooks will inevitably get you moving during their shows at the very least swaying your hips to dreamy captivating popsongs that will still be stuck in your head the next morning in your tent. Feelgood? Feelbest is more like it.

Bio: Haevn is a Dutch music duo known for their cinematic and atmospheric sound, blending indie pop with elements of ambient and classical music. They gained recognition with their debut album 'Eyes Closed' and their music has been featured in various commercials and films.
My take: Haevn's music is praised for its emotional depth and cinematic quality, making it well-suited for both intimate listening and live performances.
Festival Bio (EN): A set by HAEVN is an escape from the rush of everyday life. As soon as musical minds Marijn van der Meer and Jorrit Kleijnen and their band start playing, time stops, you rise up and drift away on sounds reminiscent of London Grammar, The xx, and sometimes Moby. That cinematic sound proved perfect for car commercials and Netflix series, but especially for dreamy open-air theaters across Europe, where the duo often surrounds themselves with a choir or orchestra. This summer HAEVN will debut at Pinkpop – talk about dream locations!

Bio: Idles are a British post-punk band known for their raw, energetic sound and politically charged lyrics, gaining critical acclaim for albums like 'Joy as an Act of Resistance' and 'Ultra Mono'. They have become a prominent voice in modern punk, addressing themes of mental health, toxic masculinity, and social justice.
My take: Idles are celebrated for their visceral live performances and ability to channel raw emotion into their music, making them one of the most compelling acts in contemporary punk.
Festival Bio (EN): After their more than successful Pinkpop debut in 2022 primal force IDLES returns to Landgraaf. This band with ideals is known for explosive performances with frontman Joe Talbot pacing and spitting at the center. True to their rebellious nature this Bristol five piece refuses to be boxed into a single genre. Raw post punk made for a wall of death ballads with a rough edge danceable collaborations with Gorillaz and LCD Soundsystem in the universe of IDLES it all makes perfect sense. You want to be part of that.

Bio: Kingfishr is an Irish indie-folk band known for their emotive lyrics, rich harmonies, and atmospheric soundscapes, gaining recognition for their heartfelt performances and growing presence in the indie music scene.
My take: Kingfishr has been praised for their heartfelt songwriting and captivating live performances, showcasing their potential to resonate with a wide audience.
Festival Bio (EN): Limerick Ireland 2022. Three college friends form Kingfishr. With frontman Eddie Keogh’s baritone and the atmospheric banjo on debut single Flowers Fire they steal countless musical hearts. They tour with James Bay and bring down festivals like Glastonbury and Pukkelpop. Back home on their farm still pinching themselves over the success the trio records Halcyon in 2025 sixteen uplifting folk songs echoing Mumford and Sons and The Dubliners inviting listeners to new adventures. From Limerick to Limburg what a fairytale journey.

Bio: Lauren Spencer Smith is a Canadian singer-songwriter known for her emotive pop ballads and powerful vocal performances. She gained widespread recognition after her appearance on American Idol in 2020 and her breakout single 'Fingers Crossed' in 2022.
My take: Lauren Spencer Smith has been praised for her heartfelt songwriting and vocal prowess, with a strong potential for captivating live performances.
Festival Bio (EN): British Canadian Lauren Spencer Smith has been making music since she could talk. No wonder this young songwriter sings to you as if she is sitting right beside you. Her soul and yours beautiful or not find a place in heavenly power pop ballads like Flowers and Fingers Crossed. On her second album THE ART OF BEING A MESS she leans more into the groove with soulful echoes of both Olivia Rodrigo and Adele. Fierce global and deeply personal Lauren Spencer Smith is all of it.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Three chords and the truth that is how they like to describe country music in Nashville. Singing about broken hearts and life on the farm is something anyone can do so rising star Max McNown prefers to look further than the length of his pickup truck. In his brutally honest country folk the American does not shy away from tough topics like loss illness and his own identity. Why would he when it results in heartbreakingly beautiful songs like A Lot More Free which helped the former street musician win over millions through social media.
My take: Max McNown's music stands out in the country/folk genre due to its raw emotional depth and focus on personal and challenging themes such as loss, illness, and identity. His ability to connect with audiences through heartfelt storytelling and his journey from street musician to social media success demonstrate his authenticity and talent.
Festival Bio (EN): Three chords and the truth that is how they like to describe country music in Nashville. Singing about broken hearts and life on the farm is something anyone can do so rising star Max McNown prefers to look further than the length of his pickup truck. In his brutally honest country folk the American does not shy away from tough topics like loss illness and his own identity. Why would he when it results in heartbreakingly beautiful songs like A Lot More Free which helped the former street musician win over millions through social media.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Roxy Dekker is rising like a comet. Her vibrant pop hits like Satisfyer and Sugardaddy stick in your head for weeks and give young women today a voice that is rarely this candid. With humor and confidence Dekker’s relatable personal lyrics hit both your sore spots and your sweet ones. Wrap that all up in a disarming live show and it is clear her star will soon shine high above Landgraaf too.
My take: Roxy Dekker's music is characterized by vibrant pop melodies and candid, relatable lyrics that resonate with young women. Her songs, such as 'Satisfyer' and 'Sugardaddy,' showcase her humor and confidence, while her live performances are described as disarming and engaging. Her style blends catchy hooks with personal storytelling, making her a compelling voice in contemporary pop.
Festival Bio (EN): Roxy Dekker is rising like a comet. Her vibrant pop hits like Satisfyer and Sugardaddy stick in your head for weeks and give young women today a voice that is rarely this candid. With humor and confidence Dekker’s relatable personal lyrics hit both your sore spots and your sweet ones. Wrap that all up in a disarming live show and it is clear her star will soon shine high above Landgraaf too.

Bio: Royel Otis is an Australian indie rock duo known for their dreamy, nostalgic sound that blends jangly guitars with catchy melodies, drawing comparisons to acts like Mac DeMarco and Phoenix.
My take: Royel Otis has been praised for their infectious songwriting and vibrant live performances, making them a rising act in the indie music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Royel Maddell and Otis Pavlovic together Royel Otis know the formula for the perfect pop song short intros uptempo beats wrapped in a breezy summer vibe and joyful sing along choruses. After releasing two EPs the Australian duo packed their instruments for global tours appearing on countless festival posters. In between they found time to record two albums the latest Hickey soaking up lush new wave and other 80s influences. What does that sound like? As if Tame Impala joined forces with The Cure golden melodies to dream away to while dancing.

Bio: Ski Aggu is a German rapper known for his energetic style and incorporation of Berlin street culture into his music. He gained attention with his unique sound and collaborations within the German rap scene.
My take: Ski Aggu has been praised for his dynamic beats and engaging performances, making him a promising act in the German rap scene.
Festival Bio (EN): A special guest is coming to town. Berlin rapper Ski Aggu is bringing his world tour to Landgraaf. He knows the way thanks to Pinkpop housemate Joost Klein and their monster hit Friesenjung which already took him to all the major European festivals. Just check his socials a must see collection of videos about his extraordinary life followed by over a million fans. There you will also find Aggu’s many other hits each one a party ready earworm with dance beats and dry witted German lyrics made for jumping with a big grin.

Bio: Sleep Theory is an alternative rock band blending heavy guitar riffs with melodic vocals, creating a dynamic and emotionally charged sound.
My take: Sleep Theory has shown great potential with their polished production and engaging live presence, making them a promising act in the modern rock scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Blending metalcore, hard rock and nu metal with pop, R&B and autotuned vocals might sound unusual but it hits hard. After touring with Shinedown and Beartooth, American quartet Sleep Theory heads to Europe on their own steam with the 2025 debut Afterglow. If tracks like Static and III already blow your speakers apart, just wait for the live show. Sleep Theory is potential earthquake material.

Bio: Sofi Tukker is a Grammy-nominated musical duo known for their vibrant and eclectic blend of house, dance, and global music influences. Their breakout single 'Drinkee' gained international acclaim, and they are celebrated for their energetic live performances and innovative sound.
My take: Sofi Tukker's music is both infectious and genre-defying, making them a standout act in the electronic music scene. Their live shows are highly praised for their energy and audience engagement.

Bio: Suzan & Freek are a Dutch pop duo known for their heartfelt lyrics and acoustic-driven melodies. They gained popularity with their covers on social media before releasing original chart-topping hits in Dutch.
My take: Suzan & Freek have been praised for their relatable songwriting and engaging live performances, making them a standout act in the Dutch pop scene.
Festival Bio (EN): For a match made in heaven Suzan and Freek have remained remarkably down to earth. For years this dream duo has been stringing together megahits like Vas-y (Ga Maar) and Als het Avond Is along with major awards and completely sold out tours. Along the way they have won millions of hearts from the very young to the very old not with flashy gimmicks or complicated tricks but simply by staying true to themselves two people just like you and us taking life as it comes. On Pinkpop Saturday we go for gold together.

Bio: Teddy Swims is an American singer-songwriter known for his soulful voice and genre-blending style, seamlessly combining R&B, soul, and pop. He gained popularity through viral cover performances and has since released original music, including his EPs 'Unlearning' and 'Tough Love.'
My take: Teddy Swims is widely praised for his powerful vocals and emotional delivery, making him a standout performer with strong live potential.
Festival Bio (EN): American singer songwriter Teddy Swims conquered the world in just about six months two years ago. Suddenly a heartwarming superstar in the making was everywhere with a wild beard diamond teeth a regular seat at the tattoo shop and above all a voice like no other. That magnificent soul voice lifts Teddy Swims’ timeless blend of R&B country rock and power pop to dizzying heights and can handle it all from megahits like Lose Control and The Door to guest spots with superstar DJs like David Guetta. Next stop Pinkpop.

Bio: The Beaches are a Canadian alternative rock band from Toronto, known for their energetic performances and catchy, guitar-driven tracks. They have received critical acclaim, including a Juno Award for Breakthrough Group of the Year in 2018.
My take: The Beaches are celebrated for their dynamic live shows and infectious energy, making them a standout act in the modern rock scene.
Festival Bio (EN): In their hometown Toronto done with dull office jobs and even duller exes sisters Kylie and Jordan Miller and friends Eliza and Leandra found each other in The Beaches. A life changing decision. One pop rock gem after another with uptempo beats and relatable lyrics like T-shirt and Blame Brett struck a chord with a growing audience. Among them some of the biggest names on earth as The Beaches became a valued support act for The Rolling Stones Foo Fighters Alanis Morissette and The Killers. What a thrill to follow in their footsteps at Pinkpop.

Bio: The Cure, formed in 1978, are a pioneering British band known for their influential role in the post-punk and gothic rock movements, with iconic albums such as 'Disintegration' and 'Pornography' defining their dark, emotive sound.
My take: The Cure are widely regarded as one of the most influential bands in alternative music, with their live performances praised for their emotional depth and extended setlists that often span their entire career.
Festival Bio (EN): Exactly forty years after their Pinkpop debut, The Cure returns to Landgraaf for a show that belongs on every festival bucket list. Timeless classics likeLullaby,A Forest, andFriday I’m in Lovegrace the record collections of countless generations—including Gen Z, who’ve embraced their enduring hits through social media. Their superpower? Simple: The Cure has a deep aversion to routine and complacency. They effortlessly shift from ominous rock to majestic pop, laced with addictive guitar riffs—and live, they’re better than ever.

Bio: The Haunted Youth is a Belgian band known for their dreamy, melancholic soundscapes and introspective lyrics, drawing comparisons to acts like MGMT and Tame Impala.
My take: The Haunted Youth has been praised for their lush, atmospheric production and emotionally resonant performances, making them a standout in the dream pop genre.
Festival Bio (EN): Boys Cry Too is tattooed on the arm of Joachim Liebens and it is also the title of the second album by his band The Haunted Youth. The Belgian frontman knows all about crying as mental struggles have followed him since childhood. He disarms his demons with dreamy layered indie rock and lyrics that pull no punches. Melancholy like The Cure hypnotic like The War On Drugs but above all deeply The Haunted Youth a band to fall in love with instantly.

Bio: The Plot In You is an American metalcore band known for their emotionally charged lyrics and dynamic sound, blending heavy breakdowns with melodic elements. They have gained a dedicated following through their evolution in style and consistent releases, including critically acclaimed albums like 'Dispose' and 'Swan Song'.
My take: The Plot In You is praised for their ability to blend aggression with emotional depth, making them a standout in the metalcore scene. Their live performances are noted for their intensity and emotional connection with fans.
Festival Bio (EN): Some days you just want to scream—out of joy, pain, victory, frustration, or for no reason at all. The Plot In You gets that like no one else. This Ohio four-piece channels that primal feeling into blistering metalcore, a fierce blend of melodic heavy metal and pitch-black hardcore punk that growls and roars the cobwebs from your mind. Lace up tight, because The Plot In You throws pure kerosene on the fire in the mosh pit

Bio: The Pretty Reckless is an American rock band formed in 2009, fronted by actress-turned-singer Taylor Momsen. Known for their powerful vocals and gritty, guitar-driven sound, they have achieved critical and commercial success with hits like 'Heaven Knows' and 'Make Me Wanna Die.'
My take: The Pretty Reckless is praised for their dynamic live performances and Taylor Momsen's commanding stage presence, making them a standout act in modern rock.
Festival Bio (EN): Taylor Momsen gave up her acting career to fully commit to her rock band The Pretty Reckless. Not a reckless but a brilliant decision, because Momsen has rock ’n’ roll flowing through her veins. One moment the frontwoman sounds like a crystal-clear angel, and the next she unleashes a powerhouse voice that demands respect. The band has worked with legends like drummer Matt Cameron (Soundgarden, Pearl Jam) and guitarist Tom Morello (Rage Against the Machine), and opened for rock institution AC/DC on their anniversary tour. Could there be a better recommendation?

Bio: Twenty One Pilots is an American musical duo known for blending genres like alternative rock, pop, and hip-hop, achieving global success with hits like 'Stressed Out' and 'Heathens.' They have won multiple awards, including a Grammy, and are celebrated for their energetic and theatrical live performances.
My take: Twenty One Pilots are widely praised for their genre-defying sound and engaging live shows, which often feature elaborate stage setups and audience interaction.
Festival Bio (EN): The rise of Twenty One Pilots is nothing short of impressive. Since 2011, the cheerful duo has been almost constantly on tour, released eight full-length albums, and kept streaming platforms and ticket services working overtime. Their long list of nominations and awards even earned its own Wikipedia page. But nothing beats their unbeatable live shows a visual spectacle with the razor-sharp flow and crystal-clear vocals of frontman Tyler Joseph at the heart of it all. From their new album Breach to festival favorite Stressed Out, Twenty One Pilots blends hip-hop, pop and rock into a delicious megamix for Megaland Landgraaf.

Bio: Wet Leg is a British indie rock duo formed in 2019 by Rhian Teasdale and Hester Chambers. Known for their witty lyrics and catchy melodies, they gained widespread acclaim with their debut single 'Chaise Longue' and their self-titled debut album, which won the 2022 Mercury Prize.
My take: Wet Leg has been praised for their refreshing, humorous approach to indie rock, and their energetic live performances have solidified their reputation as a standout act in the genre.
Festival Bio (EN): With the unruly indie rock of their award-winning debut album Wet Leg quickly conquered streaming platforms clubs and festivals. Somewhere along that victorious journey founders Rhian Teasdale and Hester Chambers decided together with their three live musicians to continue as a five-piece. That move makes the band from the Isle of Wight sound even more layered quirky and energetic on their follow-up album moisturizer. From the De Staat-like guitar riff in catch these fists to the fat distorted groove of pillow talk Wet Leg marries punk and danceable pop and lives happily ever after.

Bio: White Lies is a British band known for their dark, atmospheric sound blending post-punk revival and alternative rock, achieving critical acclaim with albums like 'To Lose My Life...' and 'Ritual'. They are celebrated for their introspective lyrics and anthemic melodies.
My take: White Lies deliver a polished and emotionally resonant sound, and their live performances are often praised for their energy and ability to connect with audiences.
Festival Bio (EN): London band White Lies last set foot in Landgraaf in 2019 and are finally treating us again to a show full of grand songs and epic singalong choruses. Anthems like To Lose My Life Bigger Than Us and Farewell to the Fairground will undoubtedly make an appearance but with their seventh album Night Light charismatic frontman Harry McVeigh and his bandmates also bring new and surprising material. This record is the ultimate proof that the young guns of the past have grown into a seasoned rock machine you do not want to miss.

Bio: Yungblud is a British musician known for blending alternative rock, pop punk, and hip-hop influences, often addressing themes of youth rebellion, mental health, and social issues in his music. He has gained a global following with his energetic performances and chart-topping albums like 'Weird!' and '21st Century Liability.'
My take: Yungblud is praised for his high-energy live shows and his ability to connect with a young, diverse audience through his outspoken and inclusive approach to music.
Festival Bio (EN): Has YUNGBLUD fallen into a boiler of music history? This cultural rebel mixes and matches rock, pop, and everything in between into an irresistible sound. That same versatility is reflected in the millions of fans of the flamboyant Brit. Young, old, beauties, beasts, they all go wild shoulder to shoulder at a YUNGBLUD show, right up to the last drop of sweat flying off the stage. On his latest albumIdols, the Pinkpop favorite is back in full force: like a (hard)rock tornado that swallows you whole, only to spit you out dazed but utterly euphoric.

Bio: Zara Larsson is a Swedish pop singer known for her powerful vocals and infectious dance-pop hits. She gained international fame with songs like 'Lush Life' and 'Never Forget You' and has received numerous awards for her chart-topping music.
My take: Zara Larsson is widely praised for her vocal prowess and ability to deliver energetic and engaging live performances, making her a standout in the pop music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Pinkpop fans know Zara Larsson means guaranteed hits in Landgraaf. The Swedish pop queen has only gained more power since her North Stage show in 2022. Especially live because after touring with Ed Sheeran and Tate McRae she now fills stadiums and arenas on her own with her biggest most colorful show to date and that says something. Of course her global hits Never Forget You Symphony and Lush Life will be there but get ready for fresh singles like Pretty Ugly and Midnight Sun with which Larsson once again won millions of hearts.
